notesStmt.note: Damp at foredge, paper soft at front. Small edge tears throughout. Usage stains. Slight worming.

Daṿid ben Sa῾id al-῾Anasi: inscribed in the colophon, folio 192r. Folio 192r: three records of birth, Se῾adyah ben Daṿid (1386), Yudah ben David (1402), and David ben Se῾adyah (1413). Folio 1r: a record of sale between Ya῾akov ben Yehudah al-Habishi and Ibrahim ben Yosef al-Sarim.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Guide for the Perplexed by Maimonides in Judeo-Arabic.

collation.p: Quires of mostly 10 leaves each, marked with signatures at the beginning.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Yemenite semi-cursive and square script of the 14th century. Shalom ben ῾Ezra al-῾Anasi: inscribed in the colophon, folio 192r.

binding.p: BM in-house. Fragments of old leather blind-tooled binding currently stored in a separate folder. Boxed.
